==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=䶮}}
{{wikipedia|劉龑|lang=zh}}
{{wikipedia|Liu Yan (emperor)}}

===Etymology===
[[w:Liu Yan (emperor)|Liu Yan]]'s original name was {{l|zh|劉[[巖]]}}. He changed {{l|zh|巖}} to {{lang|zh|龑}}, a character he invented. The character refers to a saying in the [[I Ching]], {{lang|zh|飛龍在天}} ("the flying dragon in the sky").

==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=龍04}}

# [[high]] and [[bright]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
| kanon=[[えん]] (en)
| goon=[[げん]] (gen)
}}

====Usage notes====
This kanji usage is extremely rare in Japanese. An example usage of this kanji is the use of the Chinese emperor name [[w:Liu Yan (emperor)|Liu Yan]] which can be read in Japanese as {{ja-r|劉龑|^りゅう ^げん|linkto=w:ja:劉ゲン}}.
